document.discussion_title: American Ryan Murphy wins gold in men's 200 backstroke | wltx.com
document.topic_text: American Ryan Murphy wins gold in men's 200 backstroke Nicole Auerbach, USA TODAY Sports , KING 8:34 PM. EST August 11, 2016 Ryan Murphy (USA) during the men's 200m backstroke heats in the Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games. (Photo: Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST RIO DE JANEIRO - Ryan Murphy is officially America’s next backstroke star. The 21-year-old swimmer won the men’s 200 backstroke Thursday night in a time of 1:53.62, three nights after taking gold in the 100 back. Australia's Mitchell Larkin took silver and Evgeny Rylov of Russia won the bronze. American Jacob Pebley finished fifth. Murphy will also swim in Saturday’s medley relay, a chance for a third Olympic medal. Loading... Lilly King (USA) swims during the women's 200-meter breaststroke semifinals. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) and Ryan Lochte (USA) react after the men's 200-meter individual medley semifinals. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) and Ryan Lochte (USA) swim during the men's 200-meter individual medley semifinals. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Allison Schmitt started off the women's 4x200-meter freestyle relay for the United States. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports Team USA celebrates after winning the women's 4x200-meter freestyle relay. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports The U.S. team of Maya Dirado, Allison Schmitt, Leah Smith and Katie Ledecky celebrate after winning the women's 4x200-meter freestyle relay. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports Yaxin Liu (CHN) during the women's 200m backstroke heats. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) during the men's 100m butterfly heats. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Swimmers in the start blocks during the men's 50m freestyle heats. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Long Gutierrez Feng (MEX) during the men's 100m butterfly heats. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Missy Franklin (USA) and Maya Dirado (USA) react after the women's 200-meter backstroke semifinal. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Ryan Murphy (USA) swims during the men's 200-meter backstroke final. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Ryan Murphy celebrates after winning the men's 200-meter backstroke final. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Ryan Murphy (USA) reacts after winning the men's 200-meter backstroke final. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) swims in the men's 200-meter individual medley. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) races Ryan Lochte (USA) during the men's 200-meter individual medley. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) races Ryan Lochte (USA) during the men's 200-meter individual medley. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) holds up four fingers, for his fourth gold of the Rio Games, after winning the men's 200-meter individual medley. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps and Ryan Lochte react after the men's 200-meter individual medley. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Simone Manuel (USA) during the women's 100-meter freestyle. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Ryan Murphy (USA) celebrates with David Plummer (USA) after the men's 100m backstroke final. Murphy won, and Plummer placed second. He won the race for his 20th career gold medal.
